channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Will ‘The Chair Company’ Get A Season 2 After That Wild Finale?
item.description: The Chair Company just had its season 1 finale, but will it get a season 2 to tie up all of its many loose ends?

item.title: The ‘Stranger Things’ Season 5 Volume 2 And 3 Release Dates Want You To Rearrange Your Holiday Plans
item.description: When are new episodes of Stranger Things season 5 for Volume 2 and Volume 3? Netflix wants your holidays, it seems.

item.title: IBM exec asks job candidates whether they think we are in an AI bubble as a make-or-break interview test
item.description: Do you think we’re in an AI Bubble? Even the experts can’t agree. And weirdly, your opinion on all this could decide whether you get the job.

item.title: The K-shaped economy means inflation hurts at the bottom and swells the assets at the top
item.description: “We had that kind of two-year period where the bottom was catching up and that talk of the K-shape went away,” said TSLombard economist Dario Perkins.

item.title: Climate Breakdown Is Destabilising The Global Sports Industry
item.description: Extreme weather and climate disruption put the global sports industry, from elite competitions to youth leagues, at urgent risk.

item.title: Why You Can’t Buy ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Toys This Christmas
item.description: Where can you buy KPop Demon Hunters toys? If you cannot find them anywhere on the internet, there's a reason for that.

item.title: Disney’s ‘Zootopia 2’ scores biggest international opening ever for an animated movie with $556 million haul
item.description: It was the sixth biggest North American opening of 2025. But its biggest market was China, which made for nearly half of the film’s global total.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
